product_description: Comfort Intense Fuchsia Passion Fabric Conditioner 38 Wash 570ml
review_title: Brings comfort to your clothes and your soul
review_text: I love this product. It retains the quality one expects from the well known makers and leaves clothes feeling soft and smelling fresh. The concept of ultra concentrate isn't new as I recall they did one years ago in a tetra type pack. But now maybe public are ready for this innovation. The container is made from recycled plastic which is fantastic and refillable. It is also recyclable but the sleeve isn't which is a disappointment. I'm hoping the refill packs are from a more cardboard style pack though and fully recyclable. I'm glad it has a dose counter as it seems so much less to use it would be easy to put in too much if it wasn't there. My other half and I have sensitive skin and this was fine for us to use. I found it hard to read the small print on the wrapper even with magnification glass. But I couldn't see anything to say if it was tested on animals or if any animal products used in the making. Although this is not a food product these are issues that are important for many. Whilst it provides details of the headquarter offices it doesn't actually say where its produced, I think this would be helpful to know as for many people myself included would prefer to buy products made in country of sale to reduce carbon footprint. I am a little torn about this product as if it was a washing powder or liquid and comfort softener combination I can't help thinking that cuts down packaging and carbon footprint further and can be better value. However separate comfort softener such as this does make clothes smell lovely.

CONCLUSION A decent product, which seems to work well - recommended.

I have been using this scrub for years now and I don't know of any other that comes close. Price is fab. review_text: I tried this shampoo as I have always used L'oreal Elvive for my coloured hair and wanted to change, I soon had realized that I had made a mistake!! This shampoo has Silicone in and it was only when I went to my hairdressers for my usual appointment for a colour and cut, my hairdresser asked what shampoo had I used as my hair was in such bad condition and that my hair had been stripped of the colour. I have used the Tresemme Heat Defence spray for years and have never had a problem with it. It is just a shame that this shampoo was not any good and I won't be using it again.
title_review_comments: Not as good as I thought I tried this shampoo as I have always used L'oreal Elvive for my coloured hair and wanted to change, I soon had realized that I had made a mistake!! This shampoo has Silicone in and it was only when I went to my hairdressers for my usual appointment for a colour and cut, my hairdresser asked what shampoo had I used as my hair was in such bad condition and that my hair had been stripped of the colour. I have used the Tresemme Heat Defence spray for years and have never had a problem with it. It is just a shame that this shampoo was not any good and I won't be using it again.

review_title: Worked really well on my fine, dry hair.

Highly recommend to anyone using heat styling their hair.

product_description: Cornetto Made with Soy and Gluten Free Ice Cream Cones 4 x 90ml
review_text: Im a Coeliac and intolerant to cows milk, and have a huge sweet tooth. Ive found some amazing vegan ice cream alternatives. Ocado sell a number of delicious ones. I also LOVE Tescos gluten and dairy free Cornettos However was super excited to try these, especially after all the amazing reviews. The tops are covered in nuts and chocolate, and the cone is thick and crispy. However none of these bits are quite enough to hide the awful taste of the ice cream. I cant even describe it as bland, as it had a flavour.... just an awful one. It was not creamy and ice cream like. It was like frozen whipped up soya milk that they removed the flavour from. I enjoyed eating the chocolate and nut part and the cone, and just cringed my way through the ice cream part. Cant understand all the rave reviews. The vegan Magnums however are spot on and delicious!!!
title_review_comments: Great cone. AWFUL ice cream Im a Coeliac and intolerant to cows milk, and have a huge sweet tooth. Ive found some amazing vegan ice cream alternatives. Ocado sell a number of delicious ones. I also LOVE Tescos gluten and dairy free Cornettos However was super excited to try these, especially after all the amazing reviews. The tops are covered in nuts and chocolate, and the cone is thick and crispy. However none of these bits are quite enough to hide the awful taste of the ice cream. I cant even describe it as bland, as it had a flavour.... just an awful one. It was not creamy and ice cream like. It was like frozen whipped up soya milk that they removed the flavour from. I enjoyed eating the chocolate and nut part and the cone, and just cringed my way through the ice cream part. Cant understand all the rave reviews. The vegan Magnums however are spot on and delicious!!!

product_description: Cornetto Made with Soy and Gluten Free Ice Cream Cones 4 x 90ml
review_title: It's no cookies and cream but a welcome yum treat
review_text: I was so excited to purchase this as I react to the usual dairy brands. The cone is lovely and the ice cream is nice enough to feel you are having a treat. It doesn't have the creamy feeling and texture of ice cream but near enough to eat and enjoy without any reaction! It's a little smaller than the full size cornetto but that's ok to keep the calories down. Would have liked the choc lump at the bottom of the cone. Already ordered my second box.
